intro: Ephippianthus sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin ephippium, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in forested areas. Ephippianthus sachalinensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
